thread.title: Manchester United are out of the title race, according to former Red Devils defender Nemanja Vidic
thread.title_full: Manchester United are out of the title race, according to former Red Devils defender Nemanja Vidic

author: Joe Mewis
title: Manchester United are out of the title race, according to former Red Devils defender Nemanja Vidic
text:
Sport Manchester United are out of the title race, according to former Red Devils defender Nemanja Vidic Vidic's old side are in seventh place, 12 points behind leaders Chelsea following the 1-1 draw with Liverpool Share The Red Devils were unable to see off their rivals Liverpool (Photo: John Powell)   Thank you for subscribing!   
Manchester United's title hopes are over following the 1-1 draw with Liverpool, believes former Red Devils skipper Nemanja Vidic. 
Jose Mourinho's men needed a late equaliser from leading scorer Zlatan Ibrahimovic to claw back a point against their bitter rivals at Old Trafford, following James Milner's first-half penalty. 
That leaves them 12 points behind Premier League leaders Chelsea and Vidic believes that the gap is now too big to overcome. 
"Realistically we are out of the title race," he told ESPN FC . "That's my opinion. But, in recent weeks, the way we have played is encouraging. If we keep playing like that then the top three is our target." Vidic believes the Red Devils' title hopes are over (Photo: Carl Recine/Reuters) 
United currently sit in sixth place, four points behind Arsenal in the fourth and final Champions League place. 
The Serbian says Sunday's draw at Old Trafford was a fair reflection, but rued his former side's failure to take their chances. 
"After 1-0, you take the 1-1," he said. "In the first half, we played well. We had three or four good chances and didn't take them. If you want to win the match, you have to take the chances we had. Ibrahimovic scored a late equaliser (Photo: 2017 Getty Images) The Swede celebrates his goal (Photo: Reuters) 
"In the second half, we didn't play as good as in the first one - but we scored a goal. Ibrahimovic showed his class again. One chance, one goal. Overall, 1-1 is a fair result." 
The Red Devils face a trip to Stoke next weekend, before their EFL Cup semi-final second leg against Hull and their FA Cup fourth round tie against Wigan. poll loading Where will Manchester United finish this season? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
